pullrequest.title: Fix bug in pencil.py for NLBVP solver with compound basis

content.raw: Hi Eric, the fix looks good to me, but we don't accept pull requests from named branches, because they are impossible to remove from the branch history in Mercurial repositories.  If you temporarily give me admin permission on your fork, I should be able to strip the branch, repush the commit, and update the PR.  Or if you want to give it a go, I can help over skype or email.
content.html: Hi Eric, the fix looks good to me, but we don't accept pull requests from named branches, because they are impossible to remove from the branch history in Mercurial repositories. If you temporarily give me admin permission on your fork, I should be able to strip the branch, repush the commit, and update the PR. Or if you want to give it a go, I can help over skype or email.

pullrequest.title: Fix bug in pencil.py for NLBVP solver with compound basis

content.raw:
Hey Keaton,

I opted for the easier option haha. You should be an admin now (I think).

Is there a simple guide for the best way I should be submitting pull requests to the dedalus-project?

Hope I’ve been at least somewhat helpful!

Cheers,
Eric

>

pullrequest.title: Fix bug in pencil.py for NLBVP solver with compound basis

content.raw: No problem, I just rebased the commit to the default branch and stripped the old commits.  You'll want to either reclone from here, or locally strip the old commits from your local repo as well.
content.html: No problem, I just rebased the commit to the default branch and stripped the old commits. You'll want to either reclone from here, or locally strip the old commits from your local repo as well.
